abstract: A British commission says banks should hold more capital and better protect retail customers from losses in other parts of their business, but it stopped short of proposing any major new regulations.
snippet: A British commission says banks should hold more capital and better protect retail customers from losses in other parts of their business, but it stopped short of proposing any major new regulations.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — British banks should hold more capital and better shield individual customers from losses in other parts of their business, a government-backed commission said on Monday.

headline.main: British Bank Panel Suggests Changes to Limit Risk
